speaker: Doctor
text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC) with possible metastasis to the lymph nodes, indicated by the swelling and lymphadenopathy, as well as the presence of the lesions on the penis and finger. The patient's exposure to carcinogenic substances such as pesticides and insecticides, as well as the presence of a potentially irritating substance like the strong-smelling soap, may have contributed to the development of the BCC. Further testing, such as a biopsy, would be necessary to confirm the diagnosis and rule out other potential conditions.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'm so sorry to have to tell you this, but it's a possibility that the lesions on your penis and finger could be a sign of basal cell carcinoma, a type of skin cancer. The swelling and lymphadenopathy, as well as the presence of these lesions, are all red flags for potential metastasis. I want to reassure you that early detection is key, and we can work together to confirm the diagnosis and develop a treatment plan. However, I also want to emphasize that we need to take a closer look at the lesions and the affected areas on your skin to confirm the diagnosis.
